intro: Taxanthema scabrum, commonly known as the rough taxanthemum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae, which includes many species adapted to harsh environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Taxanthema scabrum is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
